org.eclipse.january.dataset

Class LazyWriteableDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyDatasetBase
      • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyDataset
        • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyDynamicDataset
          • org.eclipse.january.dataset.LazyWriteableDataset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, IDynamicDataset, IDynamicShape, ILazyDataset, ILazyWriteableDataset, IMetadataProvider, INameable

    public class LazyWriteableDataset
extends LazyDynamicDataset
implements ILazyWriteableDataset
    Subclass of lazy dataset that allows setting slices
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getSliceView

        public LazyWriteableDataset getSliceView(int[] start,
                                         int[] stop,
                                         int[] step)
        Description copied from interface: ILazyDataset
        Get a slice of the dataset. The returned lazy dataset is a view on a selection of items
        Specified by:
        getSliceView in interface ILazyDataset
        Overrides:
        getSliceView in class LazyDataset
        Parameters:
        start - specifies the starting indexes (can be null for origin)
        stop - specifies the stopping indexes (can be null for end)
        step - specifies the steps in the slice (can be null for unit steps)
        Returns:
        The sliced view of a lazy dataset

      • getTransposedView

        public LazyWriteableDataset getTransposedView(int... axes)
        Description copied from interface: ILazyDataset
        Permute copy of dataset's axes so that given order is old order: 
          axisPerm = (p(0), p(1),...) => newdata(n(0), n(1),...) = olddata(o(0), o(1), ...)
  such that n(i) = o(p(i)) for all i
        I.e. for a 3D dataset (1,0,2) implies the new dataset has its 1st dimension running along the old dataset's 2nd dimension and the new 2nd is the old 1st. The 3rd dimension is left unchanged.
        Specified by:
        getTransposedView in interface ILazyDataset
        Overrides:
        getTransposedView in class LazyDataset
        Parameters:
        axes - if zero length then axes order reversed
        Returns:
        remapped view of data
